verses.text: Who \add is\add* as the wise \add man?\add* and who knoweth the interpretation of a thing? a man’s wisdom maketh his face to shine, and the boldness of his face shall be changed.
I \add counsel thee\add* to keep the king’s commandment, and \add that\add* in regard of the oath of God.
Be not hasty to go out of his sight: stand not in an evil thing; for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him.
Where the word of a king \add is, there is\add* power: and who may say unto him, What doest thou?
Whoso keepeth the commandment shall feel no evil thing: and a wise \add man’s\add* heart discerneth \add both\add* time and judgment.
Because to every purpose there is time and judgment, therefore the misery of man \add is\add* great upon him.
For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be?

\add There is\add* no man that hath power over the spirit to retain the spirit; neither \add hath he\add* power in the day of death: and \add there is\add* no discharge in \add that\add* war; neither shall wickedness deliver those that are given to it.
All this have I seen, and applied my heart unto every work that is done under the sun: \add there is\add* a time wherein one man ruleth over another to his own hurt.
And so I saw the wicked buried, who had come and gone from the place of the holy, and they were forgotten in the city where they had so done: this \add is\add* also vanity.
Because sentence \add against\add* an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.
Though a sinner do evil an hundred \add times\add*, and his \add days\add* be prolonged, yet surely I know that it shall be well with them that fear God, which fear before him:
but it shall not be well with the wicked, neither shall he prolong \add his\add* days, \add which are\add* as a shadow; because he feareth not before God.

There is a vanity which is done upon the earth; that there be just \add men\add*, unto whom it happeneth according to the work of the wicked; again, there be wicked \add men\add*, to whom it happeneth according to the work of the righteous: I said that this also \add is\add* vanity.

Then I commended mirth, because a man hath no better \add thing\add* under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry: for that shall abide with him of his labour the days of his life, which God giveth him under the sun.
When I applied mine heart to know wisdom, and to see the business that is done upon the earth: (for also \add there is that\add* neither day nor night seeth sleep with his eyes:)

then I beheld all the work of God, that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun: because though a man labour to seek \add it\add* out, yet he shall not find \add it;\add* yea further, though a wise \add man\add* think to know \add it\add*, yet shall he not be able to find \add it\add*.
